tags.name: video-player
tags.description:
`video-player`
`A simple responsive video player with ridiculously powerful backing`

tags.name: video-player
tags.description:
`video-player`
`A simple responsive video player with ridiculously powerful backing`

Attributes:

  * `audioOnly` {`boolean`} - Is the media an audio file only?

  * `accentColor` {`string`} - Optional accent color for controls,
using the following materialize "colors":
red, pink, purple, deep-purple, indigo, blue,
light blue, cyan, teal, green, light green, lime,
yellow, amber, orange, deep-orange, and brown.
Default is null.

  * `crossorigin` {`string`} - Cross origin flag for transcripts to load

  * `dark` {`boolean`} - Enables darker player.

  * `darkTranscript` {`boolean`} - Use dark theme on transcript? Default is false, even when player is dark.

  * `disableInteractive` {`boolean`} - disable interactive mode that makes the transcript clickable

  * `height` {`string`} - The height of the media player for non-a11y-media.

  * `hideTimestamps` {`boolean`} - show cue's start and end time

  * `hideTranscript` {`boolean`} - hide the transcript by default

  * `iframed` {`boolean`} - Computed if this should be in an iframe or not.

  * `isA11yMedia` {`boolean`} - Computed if this should be in a11y-media-player.

  * `isYoutube` {`boolean`} - The type of source, i.e. "local", "vimeo", "youtube", etc.

  * `lang` {`string`} - The language of the media

  * `linkable` {`boolean`} - Include a share link?

  * `mediaTitle` {`string`} - Simple caption for the video

  * `playerId` {`string`} - ID for a11y-media-player. 
If none specified it will be modified from schema-resource-id.

  * `preload` {`string`} - What to preload for a11y-media-player: auto, metadata (default), or none.

  * `sandboxed` {`boolean`} - Compute if this is a sandboxed system or not

  * `source` {`string`} - Source of the video

  * `sources` {`any[]`} - Source of the video

  * `sourceData` {`any[]`} - List of source objects

  * `sourceType` {`string`} - The type of source, i.e. "local", "vimeo", "youtube", etc.

  * `stickyCorner` {`string`} - When playing but scrolled off screen, to which corner does it "stick":
top-left, top-right, bottom-left, bottom-right, or none?
Default is "top-right". "None" disables stickiness.

  * `track` {`string`} - The url for a single subtitle track

  * `tracks` {`any[]`} - Array of text tracks
[{
  "src": "path/to/track.vtt",
  "label": "English",
  "srclang": "en",
  "kind": "subtitles",
}]

  * `trackData` {`any[]`} - Cleaned array of text tracks
[{
  "src": "path/to/track.vtt",
  "label": "English",
  "srclang": "en",
  "kind": "subtitles",
}]

  * `thumbnailSrc` {`string`} - Source of optional thumbnail image

  * `width` {`string`} - The width of the media player for non-a11y-media.

  * `youtubeId` {`string`} - The type of source, i.e. "local", "vimeo", "youtube", etc.
